body_html:
We have a use case where we run TensorFlowOnSpark from Apache Livy. When we set HADOOP_USER_NAME then we get an impersonation error saying that User_A cannot impersonate User_A, which is correct since we don't give permissions to User_A to impersonate other users, hence not itself.

Nevertheless, when I set HADOOP_USER_NAME Tensorflow does access HDFS as that user, so I suppose there is no need for a patch.

We have a use case where we run TensorFlowOnSpark from Apache Livy. When we set HADOOP_USER_NAME then we get an impersonation error saying that User_A cannot impersonate User_A, which is correct since we don't give permissions to User_A to impersonate other users, hence not itself.
Nevertheless, when I set HADOOP_USER_NAME Tensorflow does access HDFS as that user, so I suppose there is no need for a patch.
body:
We have a use case where we run TensorFlowOnSpark from Apache Livy. When we set HADOOP_USER_NAME then we get an impersonation error saying that User_A cannot impersonate User_A, which is correct since we don't give permissions to User_A to impersonate other users, hence not itself.

Nevertheless, when I set HADOOP_USER_NAME Tensorflow does access HDFS as that user, so I suppose there is no need for a patch.
